semantic_title: Combination Codes for Multiple Diagnoses or Diagnoses with Complications
section_path: Section I > B. General Coding Guidelines > 9. Combination Code

content.full_text: A combination code is a single code used to classify: Two diagnoses, or A diagnosis with an associated secondary process (manifestation) A diagnosis with an associated complication. Combination codes are identified by referring to subterm entries in the Alphabetic Index and by reading the inclusion and exclusion notes in the Tabular List. Assign only the combination code when that code fully identifies the diagnostic conditions involved or when the Alphabetic Index so directs. Multiple coding should not be used when the classification provides a combination code that clearly identifies all of the elements documented in the diagnosis. When the combination code lacks necessary specificity in describing the manifestation or complication, an additional code should be used as a secondary code. (Evidence: pg no: 14, L60-L61)
content.summary: Defines combination codes as single codes that classify two diagnoses, a diagnosis with manifestation, or a diagnosis with complication, with rules for when to use combination codes versus multiple codes. (Evidence: pg no: 14, L60-L61)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use combination code when it fully identifies all diagnostic conditions (Evidence: pg no: 14, L61)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a combination code exists that clearly identifies all of the elements documented in the diagnosis, only that combination code should be assigned rather than using multiple separate codes (Evidence: pg no: 14, L61)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not use multiple coding when combination code clearly identifies all elements (Evidence: pg no: 14, L61)
detailed_rules.explanation: Multiple coding should be avoided when the classification provides a combination code that clearly identifies all of the documented diagnostic elements, as this would result in redundant coding (Evidence: pg no: 14, L61)
common_applications: Avoiding separate codes for conditions included in combination
Using single combination code instead of multiple related codes
Following classification guidance for combination coding

detailed_rules.rule_text: Add secondary code when combination code lacks necessary specificity (Evidence: pg no: 14, L61)
detailed_rules.explanation: When the available combination code does not provide sufficient specificity to fully describe the manifestation or complication, an additional secondary code should be used to provide the missing detail (Evidence: pg no: 14, L61)
common_applications: Adding specific organism codes when combination doesn't specify
Adding severity codes when combination is general
Adding location codes when combination is non-specific

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify all diagnostic elements to be coded
Step 2: Check Alphabetic Index for combination code subterms
Step 3: Review Tabular List inclusion/exclusion notes
Step 4: Determine if combination code fully describes all elements
Step 5: If yes, use only combination code
Step 6: If combination lacks specificity, add secondary codes as needed
